Key Arguments: Free speech is essential to democracy and should only be limited by defamation and hate speech laws.
Truth will eventually prevail in public discourse without the need for government intervention.
The proposed legislation empowers bureaucrats to restrict free speech based on their own judgments, which is problematic.
The government and conventional media are exempt from the legislation, raising questions about fairness and consistency.
The public can discern truth from misinformation, as demonstrated during the Covid pandemic.
Excessive restriction of free speech could lead to authoritarianism, similar to Russia or China.
Notable Quotes: Free speech is a hallmark of a democracy.
Truth always triumphs eventually in public discourse.
When free speech is restricted beyond reasonable limits, we end up with Putin’s Russia or Xi’s China.
